intro: Scorzonera crispatula, commonly known as the hairy scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its tuberous roots are edible and have been used in traditional medicine. Scorzonera crispatula is valued for both its ornamental appeal and its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
